title: The game is unplayable for support secondaries.
body:
I have to queue as jungle/top or jungle/mid (even though me queing as jungle/mid is essentially jungle or feed) because if I put support anywhere near my selections, I get stuffed into support every single game. I have not rolled jungle for 5 games in a row including dodges. If you check my match record, I have played FAR more support than jungle because I've been rolling support all the time.

All this system is doing is forcing those who are willing to support but are not exclusively support players to either not put support, become exclusively support players or to troll their teams.

I know there are alot of threads on this but I don't think this issue is receiving the attention it should.

That's exactly the point! This guy -has- to stop putting down secondary supp/fill because if he doesn't, he'll never get to switch roles. It's a silly system.

This is a legitimate problem at times that'll only get worsened if these people give up support secondary permanently or at least part of the time.

It's really not fair people who are willing to play support some of the time have to do it very very often to the point they dislike and start gaming the system because some players rather not have to fill ever at all instead of rarely.

Design of the system is contrived and ultimately broken.

There should be a hidden score on your account tracking recent assignments. IMO it would be fair if secondary role pick never exceeded 50% recent selection in a 4 or 6 game span, or for fill pickers if a particular role doesn't exceed 25% recent selection in an 8 game span. The experience of these players matter too. They didn't choose to opt in as a support main.

Of course if this was done Riot couldn't exploit support secondary players to cover the queue times of the system.

You already deleted the advantage fill players had learning to be effectively versatile for the teams they had in the old draft ranked system. And this is how you reward them. No advantage except queue times, while two trick carries received the perfect system.

Yes Riot, a majority of the ranked players are happy now by gaming the system by selecting their main / then most popular role. They're exploiting certain other types of players. Stacking larger queue times for everyone, especially themselves.

This is quite normal. I am a support main so I am looking forward for some game time tonight when I get home from work. 

In order for the system to assemble groups ASAP it looks through the the bracket (bronze, silver, gold etc.) and looks for all 5 primary positions. It SHOULD be working on first come first served basis. This means that if both you and me have queued as mid mains and X as secondary role but you queued before me you will be placed in a group which required a mid laner and if there are no current groups missing a mid laner I will be given my secondary role and added to the first team in the queue which reacquires that role. However, if there are more people targeting the same primary role while at the same time a certain role requests as primary are lacking then the system will cover those "wholes" with those players who chose the missing role as their secondary one. 

I really tried to explain from coding point of view how I think this dynamic queue will work but after a wall of text I decided that it is just too confusing. It is also pointless to go into that explanation because there is a fair chance that I am wrong so I decided not to act all smart and all knowing. The first bit I wrote above should be correct (but also rather obvious). Just wanted to point out that what you are experiencing is to be expected if your secondary role is vastly missed across the teams.

I personally would like the option of 'fill excluding X'. I want to try my luck at any role sometimes, but there are some I just avoid entirely for skill purposes (jungle, in my case). Maybe that could be the improvement it needs.

Yes there is. Let you have a "secondary priority" score from 1 to 10. If you have 10, you are guaranteed to get your role. If you have 1, you fill whichever role is open so theoretically 50/50. Every 2 points gives you +10% priority to your primary role until 10 points where you are guaranteed your primary role regardless of the actual probability even if it takes you longer in queue. Every time you roll your secondary, you get +2 points.

This way it will force the system to give you your primary roll at least some of the time (regardless of queue numbers), rather than none of the time.
If you're getting tired of support, then put your secondary as the other roles. Even if they're not your best roles, you'll probably get better and it won't be as boring.
There is a simple practical solution: take jungle->mid if you want to jungle, you will never get mid. Take Sup->mid if you want to support, you will never get mid.

That would be in a world were everybody queued as X/supp. But here, if I queue as mid/top and you queue as fill, and we get paired multiple times together, you will probably never get mid because it's my primary role, and top is my secondary, meanwhile you've accepted to play in any role you are needed, which will always be (in this case) adc, jung or supp. Now add more people queuing as top/jung, adc/mid and the like and you'll realize that, if you give the system the chance to give you supp, it will do so most times. It's a fundamental flaw with the current system because "fill" is not "I want to play a bit on every role", but instead "I will fill the least popular role(s)".
